N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1160.10 - Buses-scheduled service

State Regulations
(a) General
system. A commercial ground transportation operator providing scheduled bus
service under access permit with the NFTA has the privilege of staging, loading
and unloading passengers and luggage in areas so designated by the airport
manager. (b) Rules applicable to
scheduled bus service. (1)

Vehicle appearance
and running condition. All scheduled buses shall be kept clean and in first
class running condition. (2)

Cruising. Cruising on airport property is prohibited. (3)

Unauthorized parking. Drivers of
scheduled buses shall not park in areas other than those designated by the
airport manager. (4)

Solicitation. Scheduled bus operators, or any driver or employee of such operators, shall not
engage in solicitation at the airport or in any way collaborate with or
encourage any other person to solicit business at the airport on such
operator's behalf. (5)

Improper
conduct. Scheduled bus operators, drivers, and employees shall not engage in
improper conduct, including, but not limited to, boisterous conversations, profanity or fighting at the airport, nor shall they provide misleading
information concerning their own or any other ground transportation service at
the airport, or any other service at the airport. (6)

Rates and charges made available. Approved rates and charges for all scheduled buses shall be made available by
the driver to any passenger or potential passenger upon request. This provision
shall not be construed to limit or conflict with paragraph (4) of this
subdivision, which prohibits solicitation at the airport. (7)

Vehicle requirements. All scheduled buses
and their drivers shall at all times meet all applicable requirements imposed
by the New York State Departments of Transportation and Motor Vehicles, in
addition to all other State, city and other local ordinances. (8)

Nonconcessionaire commercial vehicle
identification. Each scheduled bus shall be identified by the name of the
business that owns or operates it and must display a decal evidencing a valid
vehicle permit issued by the applicable city, State and/or township. (c) Fees and charges. As set forth
in the airport tariff as approved by the NFTA Board of
